Posted By: DLoFunk (9/30/2012 1:17:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why the hell does Ravnica still exist if several of these things are tunneling around??? This thing is the equivalent of a Great Old One!!  
  
And DLoFunk, playing this with Flash is absolutely ridonkulous.  
  
Finally, i shall note this has the same mana cost and color weight as [Polar Kraken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polar Kraken), while being +4/+4, coming into play untapped, having NO drawback AND replacing itself pretty much when it dies.

Posted By: Lord_of_Tresserhorn (9/30/2012 2:00:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like to imagine that Ravnica is Officer Kane and [Worldspine Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldspine Wurm) is Alien.  
  
Also, I love the art, it has that same misty, awesome power as conveyed in the original [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) art. To top it off, it's huge, and replaces itself when it gets killed. All in all, great card for casual, though it probably won't see play in Standard until ramp becomes a thing.
posts.html:
I like to imagine that Ravnica is Officer Kane and Worldspine Wurm is Alien.

Also, I love the art, it has that same misty, awesome power as conveyed in the original Progenitus art. To top it off, it's huge, and replaces itself when it gets killed. All in all, great card for casual, though it probably won't see play in Standard until ramp becomes a thing.

posts.post_content: So this will be my first post ever. I have this to say out of sheer interest in the artistic quality of this image. I dragged it off to illustrator and zoomed in. It's hard to see but coming out of the wurm's mouth is another wurm that has another wurm on it. posts.post_content:
With its graveyard to your library ability the only way I can think of to cheat this guy into play is with [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm) then [Lurking Predators](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lurking Predators) or [Djinn of Wishes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Djinn of Wishes). Brainstorm can also be replaced with [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) or any other hand to top of library effect  
  
Oh, and let's not forget about the good ol' [Yixlid Jailer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yixlid Jailer),  [Rise from the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Rise from the Grave) combo

Posted By: MANABURNWASGOOD (10/23/2012 7:55:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine), [Pelakka Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pelakka Wurm), and now this? Does every wurm have to be so good with [Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flash)?  
  
  
Also, now that I've had the chance to play against this card, I see why they didn't make it legendary for a number of reasons. Mechanically the legend rule would probably be abused on this fella, but also I think a big part of its nonlegendary status is it doesn't *feel* legendary. It feels like a big green fatty that might happen every once in awhile.  
  
Also, [Makeshift Mannequin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Makeshift Mannequin).
posts.html:
Wurmcoil Engine, Pelakka Wurm, and now this? Does every wurm have to be so good with Flash?


Also, now that I've had the chance to play against this card, I see why they didn't make it legendary for a number of reasons. Mechanically the legend rule would probably be abused on this fella, but also I think a big part of its nonlegendary status is it doesn't feel legendary. It feels like a big green fatty that might happen every once in awhile.
